Description:
<p>The substance involved in the accident is Vale-SAS. This product is a solid which consists of nickel sulphide and some heavy metals. On combustion sulphurdioxide, a toxic gas is formed.</p>
<p>The client never mentionned the risk of a smouldering fire. Even the SDS didn't mention the risk of a smouldering fire. There was written in the SDS that no direct beam of extinguishing water should be projected on the product. And that was not done either ... At the time of writing this accident report there was still a huge discussion on governmental level about the fact if it was&nbsp;in advance&nbsp;known that there was such a risk on smouldering fire. There is even a juridical discussion in progress about who is to blame. The risk for the formation of sulpuric acid was estimated to be very high and therefor it was strictly forbidden to target a direct beam of water on the smouldering fire.</p>
